Detailed Description

Sequence generators are used to generate unique, increasing integer values.

A sequence generator is created with an initial starting value and will then retrieve successive numbers in the sequence. Each generated number is always greater than all previous numbers produced by the sequence generator. This provides a convenient source for unique identifiers.

Function Documentation

◆ db_open_sequence()

db_sequence_t db_open_sequence ( db_t  hdb,
const db_objname_t *  name 
)

Open a sequence.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
nameSequence name. A name must start with a letter and can be followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores.
Returns
  • Sequence handle.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_ESEQ Sequence does not exist.
  • DB_EINVAL Database handle is invalid.
  • DB_ENAME Invalid squence name.
See also
db_duplicate_sequence, db_close_sequence, db_create_sequence,
db_next_sequence, db_curr_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_duplicate_sequence()

db_sequence_t db_duplicate_sequence ( db_sequence_t  hseq)

Duplicate an existing sequence.

Parameters
hseqExisting sequence handle.
Returns
  • New duplicated sequence handle.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Sequence handle is invalid.
See also
db_open_sequence, db_close_sequence, db_next_sequence, db_curr_sequence,

◆ db_close_sequence()

db_result_t db_close_sequence ( db_sequence_t  hseq)

Close a previously opened sequence.

Parameters
hseqExisting sequence handle.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Sequence handle is invalid.
See also
db_open_sequence, db_duplicate_sequence, db_next_sequence, db_curr_sequence,

◆ db_next_sequence()

db_result_t db_next_sequence ( db_sequence_t  hseq,
db_seqvalue_t *  value 
)

Obtain the next value from a sequence.

Parameters
hseqExisting sequence handle.
valueReturned value.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Casued by: invalid sequence handle, value parameter is null.
  • DB_ESEQ_OVERFLOW Sequence overflow: no unique values remain.
See also
db_open_sequence, db_duplicate_sequence, db_close_sequence, db_curr_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_curr_sequence()

db_result_t db_curr_sequence ( db_sequence_t  hseq,
db_seqvalue_t *  value 
)

Obtain the current value of a sequence.

Parameters
hseqExisting sequence handle.
valueReturned value.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Casued by: invalid sequence handle, value parameter is null.

An open transaction needed in order to obtain current sequence number.

See also
db_open_sequence, db_duplicate_sequence, db_close_sequence, db_next_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling
